thread.title: Longtime Royals fan travels with daughter from Chicago to see AL
thread.title_full: Longtime Royals fan travels with daughter from Chicago to see AL - KCTV5

author: DeAnn Smith, Digital Content Manager
title: Longtime Royals fan travels with daughter from Chicago to see AL
text:
KANSAS CITY, MO (KCTV) - Rany Jazayerli is arguably the most famous Royals fan in Chicago.
And when his young daughter got a hankering to see Kauffman Stadium, Dad couldn't deny her heart's wish. So they packed up and headed south to Kansas City to catch the first two games of the ALCS.
Jazayerli, a Kansas City native, is a dermatologist by day. And he's a writer for Grantland at night. He bleeds blue and loves to analyze his favorite team. When the Royals visit the White Sox, he's there. And when they visit the Cubs, he's especially there.
He shares his wit and wisdom on Twitter . And now he's sharing his love for the Royals with his daughter Cedra who embraced the Royals during
"Somewhere in there it clicked for her. Ever since Opening Day pf this season, I will come home from work and she's watching the Royals game," Jazayerli explained.
"It's more fulfilling to cheer for a winning team," she replied.
Cedra is enjoying soaking up the electric atmosphere at the K and learning the joys of eating great barbecue.
"I've always been to Royals games in Chicago,"she said. "We're the opposing team so people boo us. I'm excited to be a part of the home team."
It's moments that her father will always cherish.
"It's been very, very rewarding to see my daughter embracing the game," Jazayerli said.
My daughter an hour ago: "I don't like barbecue!" My daughter now: "This is so good!" Kids.
â€” Rany Jazayerli (@jazayerli) October 16, 2015 And while he is a Royals fan, he certainly isn't a homer when it comes to his writing for Grantland.
"They allow us to both embrace both the writer and analytical side of ourselves  and at the same time still maintain passion for the team we grew up being a fan for," Jazayerli said.
Click here to see his writings for Grantland.
